org.smpp.smscsim

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.smscsim.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends Object

    Class Simulator is an application class behaving as a real SMSC with SMPP interface. Clients (ESMEs) can bind to it, send requests to which this application generates responses. It also allows to send message to the bound client. It's primary use is for developers creating their SMPP applications to lessen the use of real SMSC. Should any extra functionality is required, the developers can add it to this application. Multiple clients are supported. Transmitter/receiver/transciever bound modes are supported. The bounding clients are authenticated using text file with user definitions.

    This simulator application uses SimulatorPDUProcessor to process the PDUs received from the clients.

    To run this application using smpp.jar and smscsim.jar library files execute the following command: 

     java -cp smpp.jar:smscsim.jar org.smpp.smscsim.Simulator

    If your libraries are stored in other that default directory, use the directory name in the -cp argument.

    User file can be specified using usersFileName property, e.g.: -DusersFileName=/my/path/to/users.txt

    Version:
    $Id: Simulator.java 72 2008-07-15 19:43:00Z sverkera $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team
    See Also:
    SimulatorPDUProcessor, SimulatorPDUProcessorFactory, SMSCListener, SMSCSession, BasicTableParser

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void exit()
      Stops all the currently active sessions, stops the listener and the exits the application.
      protected void listClients()
      Prints all currently connected clients on the standard output.
      protected void logToScreen()
      Changes the log to screen status.
      static void main(String[] args)
      The main function of the application displays menu with available options.
      protected void menu()
      Displays menu with available simulator options such as starting and stopping listener, listing all currently connected clients, sending of a message to a client, listing all received messages and reloading of user (client) definition file.
      protected void messageList()
      Prints all messages currently present in the message store on the standard output.
      protected void reloadUsers()
      Reloads the user (client) definition file used for authentication of bounding ESMEs.
      protected void sendMessage()
      Permits data to be sent to a specific client.
      protected void start()
      Permits a user to choose the port where to listen on and then creates and starts new instance of SMSCListener.
      protected void stop()
      Stops all the currently active sessions and then stops the listener.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException
        The main function of the application displays menu with available options.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • menu

        protected void menu()
             throws IOException
        Displays menu with available simulator options such as starting and stopping listener, listing all currently connected clients, sending of a message to a client, listing all received messages and reloading of user (client) definition file.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • start

        protected void start()
              throws IOException
        Permits a user to choose the port where to listen on and then creates and starts new instance of SMSCListener. An instance of the SimulatorPDUProcessor is created and this instance is passed to the SMSCListener which is started just after.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • stop

        protected void stop()
             throws IOException
        Stops all the currently active sessions and then stops the listener.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • exit

        protected void exit()
             throws IOException
        Stops all the currently active sessions, stops the listener and the exits the application.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • messageList

        protected void messageList()
        Prints all messages currently present in the message store on the standard output.

      • reloadUsers

        protected void reloadUsers()
        Reloads the user (client) definition file used for authentication of bounding ESMEs. Useful when the user setting is changed or added and restart of the simulator is not possible.

      • logToScreen

        protected void logToScreen()
        Changes the log to screen status. If logging to screen, an information about received and sent PDUs as well as about connection attempts is printed to standard output.

      • listClients

        protected void listClients()
        Prints all currently connected clients on the standard output.

      • sendMessage

        protected void sendMessage()
                    throws IOException
        Permits data to be sent to a specific client. With the id of the client set by the user, the method sendMessage gets back the specific reference to the client's PDUProcessor. With this reference you are able to send data to the client.
        Throws:
        IOException
